meanings.definition: A person who carves or engraves designs on whalebone or ivory.
meanings.sent1: The talented scrimshanders showcased their intricate carvings at the art exhibition.
meanings.sent2: The scrimshanders in the old whaling village were highly skilled artisans.
meanings.sent3: The scrimshanders decided to have a carving competition to see who could create the tiniest design.
meanings.sent4: Her delicate hands moved like a scrimshander's tools, etching beauty into the ivory.
meanings.sent5: The scrimshanders' work told stories of the sea, capturing the imagination of all who saw.

meanings.sent1: The scrimshanders gathered at the museum to discuss their shared passion for carving.
meanings.sent2: In the antique shop, you could see various scrimshanders displayed on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The scrimshanders' convention was a lively event with carvings from around the world.
meanings.sent4: The scrimshanders' collection of tools was a testament to their dedication to their craft.
meanings.sent5: Each of the scrimshanders had a unique style, making their carvings distinct and special.
